website_summaries.verdict: Sound quality doesn't match higher-end models, but they offer good quality and a nice price.
pros: These headphones stand out for noise cancellation and comfort
Nice sound range, with up to 80 hours of battery life
cons: Made from plastic and don't feel particularly durable
The sound is too tinny for some users

website_summaries.verdict: The perfect combination of features, comfort, and affordability make up for the few shortcomings. It's a great deal for the budget-conscious consumer.
pros: Feel lightweight and comfortable on your ears even if you wear glasses
Some owners find these headphones very helpful for reducing noise on airplanes or in offices
Fold nicely for carrying or storing
cons: May not reduce all ambient noise in all situations
Sound quality is good, not excellent
Not a lot of bells and whistles, but for the low price, you may not mind

customer_reviews.title: They work great on my long flights overseas
customer_reviews.text: They work great on my long flights overseas! It is amazing how much noise they cancel out for the price. I was able to actually get some sleep on my flight, which I am usually unable to do because of the engine roar.
customer_reviews.author: KCMichaels

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item on April 2015. Poor quality of noise reduction as pointed out by other reviewers. Very poor workmanship: the battery cover falls off, lucky to find it between plane seats, the material covering the foam started to peel off leaving black residues on my head and clothing after one year of use. Recently ordered replacement foam pads from Sony Customer Service that contracts with a company named Encompass. The price of a replacement was $21.56 that I made the stupid mistake of agreeing to pay. It turns out that they are not the advertised size and they only sent "one pad" as if we humans have just one ear!! Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Wolfzilla

customer_reviews.title: Poor build quality...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter , the cord that connects it to the headphones Is so thin one little tug, yes broke.the wires are so thin inside you would have to be a brain surgeon to fix it.very disappointing. I guess you get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.author: norbert

customer_reviews.title: Started coming apart in 6 months of minimal use
customer_reviews.text: Decent sounding headphones but the leather foam covering started to come apart after less than 6 months of use. I only ever use these when I travel so it's really disappointing that they come apart with very minimal wear. I would return them and buy another brand if I could
customer_reviews.author: Winston

customer_reviews.title: This did not work on the cross-country flight I was ...
customer_reviews.text: This did not work on the cross-country flight I was on — NOT AT ALL! I ended up buying the Bose QC 25. Instantly upon comparison, the Bose headphones made a difference in cutting down the noise. (I will be trying the Bose on an international flght shortly).
customer_reviews.author: Frau Schott

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss, and I lost
customer_reviews.text: Bummer, used on only 4 travel trips in last 16 months, total listening time less than 15 hours. Just got on a flight, settled in and found the right headphone ‘out’ and no noise reduction. Checked my wife’s and her battery with mine to see if that was the issue, but it was not.
customer_reviews.author: FarmerR

customer_reviews.title: They look good, but sound awful!
customer_reviews.text: These things look nice, and are fairly comfortable to wear, however, the sound quality is TERRIBLE! Everything sounds muffled, and it's really weird how these headphones seem to highlight some sounds, while dimming others, making them sound like they're in the background. I tried messing around with my EQ settings as much as I could, and just could not get these things to sound clear. Compared with my Sony MDR-NC7's, these MDRZX110NC's belong in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.text: My wife got these for a flight recently and said they were great on the plane when connected to an iPad Pro. Since then, I've taken to using them for casual listening or learning new music. No doubt there are much better noise cancelling headphones out there (I had the Bose headphones for a long time until they literally fell apart), but these are quite good for the money. They are comfortable and do a fair amount of noise cancellation (once turned on) for an over-the-ear headset. Minus one star for the lack of a carry case or pouch (should've kept the case from my old Bose phones now that I think of it!).
customer_reviews.author: P. Revelli

customer_reviews.title: Blocked a screaming baby on a 5-1/2 hour flight and enjoyed my music.
customer_reviews.text: I had an expensive set of noise canceling earphones (over $200) and left them in a hotel room they were so bad. Bought these for under $40. Took a 5-1/2 hour flight with a screaming baby a few rows behind. Flipped on the noise canceling switch the whole trip, turned the volume up slightly and enjoyed the flight. No, they are not going to remove every exterior sound but for the price I give them 2 thumbs up. Worked better than the more expensive ones I had.
customer_reviews.author: David E.

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Rubish.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for 2+ years and right away the little side cover kept falling off and the battery coming loose. After that the ear cushion became detached and I had to superglue it back. Later the cheap plastic bridge thqt holds the two sides together broke and had to be taped together. The material that presses against the ears if falling apart on one ear. Maybe in these days of disposable junk (made in China mostly) this is considered acceptable by some mostly young people who don't know what quality is. But this is not acceptable to me. They do sound good and the noise cancelling was good so I gave them 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A

customer_reviews.title: Great for a plane ride!
customer_reviews.text: These were amazing for the plane ride. They pressed a bit on my ears and were a bit uncomfortable but for the price and the amazing noise cancellation that made music really enjoyable and feel like decent quality on the plane. One caveat is music really only sounds good in general with noise cancellation on, but that's really not a big deal if you're only using them for travelling.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Lott

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Cheap. Tired of stuff being lousy.
customer_reviews.text: They function fine. No noise cancelling (not that I expected it for 30$). Very flimsy. Cheap. Definitely more of an 18$ set if you ask me. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. BennettTop Contributor: Aquascaping

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed Overall. As earmuff style headphones they don't form a good enough seal around the hears to block out external noises. Additionally, the sound quality was quite lacking. Returned them and went back to my inexpensive "noise isolating" earbuds that block out external noises much better, as well as has much fuller sound quality. I'm sure there are good quality noise canceling headphones out there, but sadly these are not it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Sony did not disappoint
customer_reviews.text: These are JUST like my former favorite headphones (also Sony, similar in form and function), which lasted me YEARS. These have incredibly rich sound for their size, they're super comfortable, and the noise cancellation worked really well on multiple long flights. I did notice that because the noise cancellation is rooted in the functionality on the right side, if I took them off and put them back on my right ear was particularly affected (the noise cancellation seemed uneven) until I got used to it. That said, this is my ONLY "complaint". Love these things.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancelling is a joke.
customer_reviews.text: Very unimpressed. My $10 headphones sound just like these, very little noise cancelling difference. Returning immediately. If you want headphones to block external sound, avoid these like the plague.
customer_reviews.author: H.J.Feltz

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly low quality
customer_reviews.text: With a Sony name, I expected a lot more. We already have several Sony brand headphones in the house, but the "noise cancellation" was completely unnoticable and the construction was surprisingly cheap. One of the earphones went completely out and now we only get sound out of one side. I'm honestly shocked. This won't keep me from buying Sony again, but I feel a bit ripped off by this set.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I had waited to write this review until after I had used these headphones on an overseas trip. Now that I have, with all things considered (price, noise cancellation, sound quality, volume) I would say they are a great find at under $30! Truly, they were comfortable on my head/ears (worn for the better part of a 10 hour flight) and the sound for the movies that I watched was very good. The noise cancellation feature can be switched on and off (must be off for takeoff and landing) is okay, not great, but definitely sufficient for the price. If you’re looking for an inexpensive pair of well-performing headphones with an aux cord, these are for you.
customer_reviews.author: Erica G

customer_reviews.title: On the ear, not over the ear - very tight against the ears and unconfortable
customer_reviews.text: Despite description (unless Amazon changes it in the future), these are NOT over the ear headphones. They are much too small for that; they are On the Ear. Less comfort and less noise blocking ability. They were very uncomfortable, much too tight. Headband is plastic, so no opportunity to bend the headband to lessen pressure on your ears. Headphones with padded metal headbands can usually be carefully bent to lessen pressure.
customer_reviews.author: AndrewS

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace the same model Sony noise cancelling headphones I had purchased maybe 10 years ago. Those were great, well built, sounded great. I just simply wore them out and now need to replace them. In comparison this newer model seemed cheaply built, has less sound quality, and just not the same solid build. A huge minus to Sony for the quality downgrade. I ended up returning and purchased another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D.

customer_reviews.title: Buy Them NOW!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a large office where there is alot of noise. Since I do data entry its hard most of the time to relax and do my job in peace because of people laughing, eating, smacking and talking loudly....mainly the one who sits right behind me. There is no consideration whatsoever for her coworkers. This was the 3rd pair of "noise cancelling" headphones I have purchased but the ONLY ones that absolutely block the noise. I would highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: For $25 should one expect to receive Bose-quality noise reduction headphones? Of course the answer is no. However, do these reduce the constant hum of being in a plane or similar? Yes they do. (Note the word 'reduce' -not eliminate). They do little for other noise - if this is your expectation, you will not come back and write an unhappy review. Plus, I think they sound fantastic for the price - and you get Sony build-quality. The part that goes over your head isn't padded and some may dislike that - I found I got used to it quickly. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Exposed wiring after less than three months use.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for an international flight in June 2018. They were wonderful for the long flight. The price was reasonable and they kept me from getting an awful headache from the engines. However, after less than three months use, the wiring is now exposed. If it weren’t for this, these headphones would have received a higher star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, awful fit.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife because she wanted something cheap but with noise cancellation. The headset has really good sound, and noise cancellation is pretty decent... but unfortunately, neither of us could find a comfortable way to wear these. The small ear pads dig in and the headset just... hurts after a short amount of time. Unfortunately, that makes them essentially useless to us. But, I suppose YMMV...
customer_reviews.author: eagle79

customer_reviews.title: Impressive sound quality but came apart after only 2 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the sound quality and the noise cancelling ability of this inexpensive headphones. But the left foam ear piece came off the headphone only after 2 months of casual use, rendering it useless. Would not buy again. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Blue_Steel_Look

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: These are relatively low cost noise attenuating head phones I bought for use on airplanes. The video monitors on aircraft do not have blue tooth so finding a plug in model was actually a little hard to find. They work far better than earbuds. Remember to turn them off when not in use or you could wear out the battery, which is easily replaced. They work very well although you are not in an absolute silent situation in a noisy environment. The odd thing is that when an announcement comes over the airplane PA and through the monitor at the same time, you hear both but not background noise.
customer_reviews.author: California Dan

customer_reviews.title: thumbs down
customer_reviews.text: They do an ok job at playing music but the noise cancelling is very poor.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Block

customer_reviews.title: Good sound. Fast delivery.
customer_reviews.text: I've used higher priced noise cancelling headphones before, but for me I'm just not willing to pay that kind of money for something I only use occasionally on a trip. These headphones have a good noise cancelling for listening to audio, but still being able to hear outside sounds if needed. If you are looking for headphones that will totally cancel out any outside sounds...this is not your item. These work perfect for me & I would definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: AuntBoo2u2

customer_reviews.title: These are not meant for an audiophile; but are great value for casual user.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these at the airport for aeroplane flights. Work great. After turning on the noise-cancelling; I couldn't believe how much of a given song I was missing. Was like putting on a pair of glasses and seeing the detail of the leaves on a tree instead of just a green tree with some leaves. I'm sure there is better out there for the audiophile; but for casual user- these are a good value.
customer_reviews.author: djd

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT over-the-ear!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this headphone and will be returning it immediately. It was advertised as an over-the-ear headphone but it is on-the-ear. It began hurting my ears within 60 seconds of putting them on. I didn't even plug them in so I can't comment on sound quality or noise cancelling. But, I wanted them for a 10 hour flight to Europe and they just don't have the comfort level I was hoping for with over-the-ear. Do not be deceived, this headphone is NOT over-the-ear and had I looked at the photo more closely I could have seen that the ear opening was much too small.
customer_reviews.author: R.K.

customer_reviews.title: Sony, You Can Do Better
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these headphones is roughly equal to the free ones you used to get on airplanes back in the 90's. Except the free ones worked. These don't cancel any noise, barely fit on an adult's head, and feel like they were assembled by a drunk on a bet.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Okennon

customer_reviews.title: Expected better from Sony
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy plastic headphones that don't sound that great. Noise cancelling feature is almost non-existent. It removes less than half of ambient noise despite it's claims of 95% - and that is due to the passive noise isolation from the foam earmuffs. You can detect a hint of noise removal on the right side because that is where the battery operated component is. Since the ANC unit is not centrally located on the wire before it splits to left/right sides, your left side does not benefit and you can still hear background noise in your left ear.
customer_reviews.author: Hattori Hanpei

customer_reviews.title: Spend $20 more and be significantly happier
customer_reviews.text: The good: the sound quality was good. Nothing to write home about, but certainly passable for the price point. The average: the audio cable isn't removable / replaceable, and usually that's the first part the break on these things. Also the battery is a standard AA/AAA (don't remember), so they're not rechargeable unless you also buy a rechargeable battery. The bad: the noise cancellation (both active and passive) was basically non-existent. I ended up spending $10 or $20 more on some MPOW headphones and was much happier with them. They had significantly better noise cancellation, were bluetooth capable, had a removable 3.5mm cord, and a rechargeable battery.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Not noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: In no way are these noise cancelling earphones. I bought them because I didn’t want to spend the money on the more expensive Bose headphones. Yes, the Bose ones are expensive (approx $174 vs these at $36) but if you really need noise cancelling these are a waste of the $36. Either buy the Bose or keep searching but these aren’t the ones to buy. I’m fact, the cheaper in-ear MaxRock earphones have much better noise cancelling properties and are a third of the price of these Sony ones.
customer_reviews.author: ELyall

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones but minimal noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: Just got these today and am using them at work. A battery came with it which is great. I listen to podcasts and so when noise cancelling is turned on I can still here the tech support guy a couple cubes away- although he sounds more like the adults in a Peanuts cartoon so it's less distracting (i.e. "Wah-wah-wah). However if I listen to music Its better but still can hear. You couldn't use these to totally block others on a plane unless you blast music. Really cool is that no one can hear what I'm listening to and they are comfortable on my head - not too huge. The audio sounds great for voice and especially music.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. I've had Bose for about 12 years, but the foam around the earpieces began disintegrating recently. I wanted to replace the Bose for a cross-country plane trip, but didn't want to break the bank. These Sony headphones fit the bill perfectly. First, the price cannot be beat. But also, the sound quality is surprisingly sharp. And while the Sony headphones don't give the ear coverage of the Bose, they still do a very effective job of reducing noise on the plane. I love the headphones. And I bought a second pair for my wife. These are the first headphones she has ever used, and she loves them as well. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: J. Webber

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of headphones SO FAR.
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones so far! I have own quite a few headphones, and my issues with them range: headphones are too large and/or uncomfortable, they do not block out sound enough, etc. I really like these. The style is pretty sleek compared to some others, the earpads are comfortable, no problems adjusting the length of the frame. It also blocks out sound really well. I have a loud household, but background noises fade when I put music on and even more so when I flit the noise cancelling switch. I think it was well worth the price and would definitely buy this again, provided that the quality doesn't decline. We'll see what happens in the next few months / year,
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones
customer_reviews.text: We bought these headphones to replace another set of Sony headphones. After reading other reviews, we bought these headphones. My wife is the user of these headphones and she loves them. They are easy to use and she loves using them when we are flying. She also uses them with her iPad to listen to TV shows she streams. The sound is very clear and the noise cancelling ensures she gets the best sound without having external noise as well.
customer_reviews.author: David Bonhomme

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality for price point - comfortable and works
customer_reviews.text: I just used these on the plane. While the cancelling noise was not that efficient it did work to some degree. The clarity of the sound for watching movies on the plane was great. On the trip to New York I just used the headset for cancelling noise so I could sleep (it helped). On the way back I watched movies and the sound was excellent. The headset was very comfortable. I have already recommended them to family members. Obviously not as good as Headphones that you would pay a lot more for but very good for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Active 70+ women

customer_reviews.title: A very nice replacement
customer_reviews.text: The pin got bent on my last pair of headphones so I replaced them with these and they do the a good job for work headphones where I am listening to online meetings and to music. I don't quite get the noise cancelling part. When I put in the battery, and switch it on, I can't tell the difference. Perhaps you need studio quality headphones to have true noise cancellation or maybe it is noise blocking I am looking for? I think noise cancellation is a gimmick, nonetheless even if I find the feature useless I would still give this product 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure what to expect since they were much cheaper than Bose, but brought them on an overseas trip and they worked really well on the plane. It blocked a lot of the plane noise and made it much easier to hear the videos and music on the plane. That said, when I wasn't actually listening to music, I could hear most of the plane noise and talking.
customer_reviews.author: Quackers

customer_reviews.title: Only had briefly, but seems to be excellent value as per most of reviews. But, note these are On Ear, NOT Around Ear.
customer_reviews.text: Only had briefly, but seems to be excellent value as per most of reviews. Nicely isolating even w/out the noise reduction (NR) activated. The NR seems to reduce some background noise, but real test will be on upcoming air travel. Lightweight but doesn't seem cheaply made. Sound spectrum seems well balanced; the NR does slightly brighten the sound. Biggest complaint: description by this & other vendors (& even some Q&A respondents) clearly states "around ear", but these are absolutely "on ear" (unless your ears are the size of a mouse's!). That was pretty disappointing but fir the price I've decided to keep them.
customer_reviews.author: Gator Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Well made and work great
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes I have difficulty hearing the damn tv, especially when there is loud background music and sometimes women's dialogue when they speak softly. My daughter was given a set of these headphones and when I tried them out I was stunned. I no longer need volume control, the level of sound is perfect; the sound quality is great; and I'm not distracted by whatever is going on in the tv room around me. The noise cancelling works well. They are just about perfect for the price, however, a longer cord would be greatly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Little Red Haired Girl

customer_reviews.title: Thin wires that pull apart. Completely unusable.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these headphones for 4 months. I use them regularly, but not excessively. I use them with a Mac mini that hangs on the back of my monitor. The cord is so short, i have to be in front of my screen. I cannot turn my head or lean away to pick something up. Recently, the sound starts cutting out. When I start checking into it, the wires are pulling out from where the cord splits to the left and right side and copper wires are exposed. These wires are super thin. Too thin for regular use. I would not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A. Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: Probably not the best quality, but works for me
customer_reviews.text: The band wasn't comfortable on the top of my head (3 stars), so I took some foam and an old t-shirt to make a padded portion on top. The quality won't completely tune out outside noise, but it doesn't do a bad job either. I used these on a long haul flight and now use them in my noisy office. I had purchased one of the top brands and was disappointed. These aren't as fancy, but my poor hearing didn't experience a big enough difference to warrant paying hundreds of dollars for "the best" out there. These do just fine. The top of the line is probably more comfortable, at least I would hope so.
customer_reviews.author: rebizzy

customer_reviews.title: The noise cancelling works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones and tried the noise cancelling button at home. I couldn't hear any difference when I turned it off or on. I figured that it was just a gimmick, or so subtle that I couldn't hear the difference. Then I took these headphones onto a flight. Wow! The noise cancelling is significant. It's quite good. It really removes much of the airplane sound. These headphones are totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Good product for its price
customer_reviews.text: it is light-weight and nicely designed. I have used it on airplanes, buses and trains, as well as in office and home. The noise cancellation is not as good as advertised, especially for lower frequencies--I am a little surprised because the design is sealed-off type. I set the volume at the middle on my iPhone and MacBook Pro, which is the recommended setting for hearing. I tried classical symphonies, cello played by Yo-Yo-Ma, Harp solo, Jazz (Chicago), Blues, Rocks, etc. The quality of sound is good. I have no complain for the price vs quality. Will recommend to people who are looking for good quality affordable price headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: While I prefer wired headphones, these are not quite up to my standards. They are on ear, no volume control, single AAA battery lasts a couple hours at most at which point the noise canceling is off. When the battery gets low, the NC cuts in and out with loud pops (could just be a combination of the source [PC] and the headphones). The sound quality is about $30 worth. For every day use, might want something else. For a single flight, these might make it through (so long as its a domestic flight).
customer_reviews.author: L. Gaulin

customer_reviews.title: Should NOT be Called Noise Cancelling
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other (cheaper) brands this headset is weak or NOT noise canceling. I see lots of 4-5 star reviews, but I’m guessing they haven’t tried another noise canceling headset to compare with. The sound quality for music is actually very good, but its noise canceling function is nearly useless. I can still easily hear the subtle bathroom fan, the dryer, and other constant sounds when I turn on this headset. My wife had another (cheap knockoff) noise cancelling headset that she got as a giveaway from work, and those work amazingly well to cancel ambient noise. This Sony headset does not come close to that one. I’m disappointed at this device especially after seeing so many good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: GNB

customer_reviews.title: Great product for price
customer_reviews.text: The sound is good for the price. I switched between these and my daughter's Beats to test. The Beats had a little better sound but should for $175+ more. The Sony headphones are a little warmer on the ear than ones with real leather cushions but should be OK. The noise cancellation function is more of a boost for fuller sound. Don't expect to block out really loud sounds with these. Also, if someone has an issue with sound it is worth checking the equalizer settings in your device. I never used my iphone equalizer in the past but it helped when using headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Spenn

customer_reviews.title: Value alternative to Bose
customer_reviews.text: I spend a lot of time on airplanes and used to use a set of Bose headphones, mostly to watch movies on planes. My Bose headphones were stolen and I bought these as a value alternative. Having used them on a trans-Atlantic flight I am happy to say that although they don't block sound as well as the Bose phones (which are near 100%, especially for engine noise) they block more than enough for movie sound and dialogue to be clearly heard. I am definitely satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Haskell

customer_reviews.title: Do not serve the purpose
customer_reviews.text: Ear pads are about 2 3/4 in in diameter, and do not cover the ears. Maybe a good size for a toddler. A lot of noise goes around the ear pads right to your ear. The noise canceling effect is almost unnoticeable. You may help a lot by pressing the headphones to your head with your palms. Actually, I sat much of my flight with my hands pressing on the headphones to have the noise canceled to some degree, but this is definitely not a solution. My conclusion - useless waste of money. Fortunately, only $27. Going to buy a higher model Sony or Bose. I and my wife tried to adjust the headphones as much as we could, but
customer_reviews.author: Yury

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones when poweered on.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an audiophile, but these headphones sound great, when poweered on. Right out of the box, I tested them listening to Tool, Radiohead and Peter Gabriel and they all sounded terrific WITH THE POWER ON. I could hear background sounds and textures (in the songs) I could barely hear with my old non-powered set. Again, the battery installed and the power on is a must, because when turned off, these headphones are nothing special.
customer_reviews.author: jrjohn77

customer_reviews.title: the ear cushions are very comfortable, allowing her to wear them through 4 movies ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my wife to use on trans-Atlantic flights to combat engine noise. She was used to using ear buds and what a noticeable improvement! The noise cancellation feature worked extremely well, even on a flight where we sat in the last row and had constant engine drone. Also, the ear cushions are very comfortable, allowing her to wear them through 4 movies with no fatigue or discomfort. The single AAA battery didn’t show any signs of weakening either after 2, 8+ hour flights. I’m going to order a second pair for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Neal D

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful headphones for the price unless you expect effective noise-canceling.
customer_reviews.text: I like to go to sleep listening to music or podcasts without disturbing my wife. But I've not found a pair of ear buds that are comfortable for me. These headphones are very comfortable and stay on as a maneuver through various positions attempting to fall asleep and the sound quality is very good considering the price. However, if you need noise reduction as a feature, these are not for you. My wife listens to podcasts without the aid of headphones and the purported noise-canceling for these headphones does absolutely nothing to reduce the sound coming from her podcasts.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Schenk

customer_reviews.title: Saved hundreds of bux
customer_reviews.text: For the price, can't go wrong. Tested on riding mower. Cut sound of mower down considerably. Used on flight, could hear voices somewhat, but definitely lessened the sounds of flight. Sound quality average. Saved me hundreds of dollars and works fine. A little uncomfortable but acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Nice Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended to me by a friend. They are comfortable and don't allow any audio to be heard by anyone around me which helps in my line of work. The noise cancelling feature is okay - these will not block out all noise. They would be better described as "noise softening headphones." When you turn on the feature, a slide on/off switch sleekly designed into the right ear cup, you'll notice noises move to the background of your hearing. It's helpful when studying so suits my needs.
customer_reviews.author: M. Williams

customer_reviews.title: For the price.  These headphones are great.
customer_reviews.text: For the price. These are good. Totally cancelled out the ability to hear people talking. My chair is near the tv. I could still hear the tv, but I could hear all the slightest of noises in the movie I was watching on my iPad. The earphones themselves, cushion earpiece is very comfortable for me. I have small ears so it fits perfect. I really love these so far.
customer_reviews.author: June S. Josten

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing Headphones
customer_reviews.text: The old saying “you get what you pay for” was never truer than with this product. I watched a youtube review before purchasing. Here’s the major issue I have with these headphones; the way they are manufactured they amplify every sound, touch, bump, etc. through the all plastic headphones and that becomes as annoying as the sound you are trying to cancel out. I thought that Sony name it might different. Don’t waste your money on these. Spend a little extra money on a quality pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Noise Cancelling!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my ADHD son who has a hard time concentrating when there is commotion around him. Nowadays, over 50% of classroom study is done on a computer. The school supplied cheap headphones that didn't cancel background noise and my son couldn't stay focused on his work. I bought these for my son and it made a huge difference. I've used them a few times and they really do cancel the background noise in a room. They fit snuggly and are really comfortable. I'm really happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, quality, and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Quite amazing sound considering the low price. I originally purchased these to use on airline flights to cancel out the engine noise, and they work quite well for that. But I also use them while working at my home office. The noise cancellation feature works well to eliminate constant noises, like fans, humming noises, etc. They are not as effective at eliminating background music or people talking. I use these more often than I thought, and the quality of the sound is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas H.

customer_reviews.title: Not noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: These are okay headphones. They do not work as noise cancelling, unfortunately. They have a battery, that makes them sound a but richer than other headphones, and that is it. Also, the padded part is very small. I have small ears, and consider them small! Sony overall is a very good headphone brand. These, unfortunately do not fit the bill
customer_reviews.author: ILoveAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones but don't last that long (about 3 - 6 months)
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 pairs as they eventually break, buzzing, one ear stopped working. My biggest complaint is there is an on/off switch for noise cancellation and I always forget to turn it off when headphones aren't in use so battery dies. The noise cancelling is very good. There are times when people have to tap me on the shoulder to get their attention. Their are some noisy people and loud sounds that it won't block. But great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Al Berg

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend them for airplane noise
customer_reviews.text: You just can't beat them for the price. I highly recommend them for airplane noise, road noise, or any other repetitive noise. For noises like conversations, babies, horns, crashing plates, etc, they won't remove the noise so much as dull it...but that's still preferable to the alternative. Beats the hell out of sitting on a flight with a screaming baby and no recourse.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancellation is great.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these headphones to replace over the ear Bose headphones which had succumbed to 12 years of use. I am very happy with the quality of the noise cancellation feature although I'm not thrilled to have to change a battery and to have to remember to turn off that battery switch each time I finish using the headphones. Ahhhh, new habits to form. Overall, I am very pleased with the quality. I do want to mention that I agree with the review that brought up the short cord. It is alittle too short but I already have an extension for my purposes. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Teq Lady

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son. He had a similar Sony set that he wore the pads off. The were really cheap but sounded decent and held up to a pre-teen/teen for several years. I wanted to get a similar set but maybe a step or two up on the sound quality level now that he's getting older. I ordered these and gave them to him for Christmas. The next day I noticed he had his old set on. He said they sounded better. I compared the two and sure enough... they did. So these are going back. Got him a nice set of Sennheisers for his trouble ;-) and all is good.
customer_reviews.author: vicky regis

customer_reviews.title: Finally A Product That Works!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound! These are the newer version of the old sound cancelling headphones and they are nicer too. They have a panel that houses the battery that is required if you want more surround sound. It comes with a AAA battery and has a two prong adapter if your flying and needing one. They are lightweight and can fold. I will be buying a case for them.
customer_reviews.author: Thumbs-Up!!

customer_reviews.title: Good Value & Travel-Friendly for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with these headphones. I originally owned a pair of the regular Sony headphones (without the noise cancelling option) in white, but my son broke his and so I gave him mine. They look and fold pretty much exactly the same. I almost bought another of the same pair, but decided to upgrade to this noise-cancelling version. I loved how flat they fold. I put them into a zippered-pencil case and slip them into my tote. They take up very little room compared to more traditional NC headphones and they are more comfortable for long periods of time compared to in-ear headphones. If you don’t have overly high expectations for the price, you will be happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Mama

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap feeling. Noise cancellation is poor to non-existent. The headband is not padded so after a short time of having that hard plastic on top of your head it hurts...a lot! Sound is okay but no better than any other $30.00 headset. Do yourself a favor and spend the extra money for a quality set.
customer_reviews.author: independent

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sub par sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Are they a decent pair of headphones with noise cancelling? Yes, and the noise cancelling works great for sounds that I can test it with. Without the noise cancelling, they aren't big enough to give you an amazing sound experience. If you care a little bit for sound quality I would get some nicer headphones, if an open back isn't going to be an issue for you, I would recommend it. If they are an issue, they are plenty of closed back headphones with more quality than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery M.

customer_reviews.title: Great, low-cost option for non-audiophiles
customer_reviews.text: Way better than expected. It is more "noise reducing" than "noise cancelling", but pretty darn good for the price. Just enough to take the edge off ambient room noise when I need to concentrate. If you need to hear the nuances of the 3rd cello in Beethoven's 9th, on a plane, with a screaming baby in the next row, then pony up $400 for a Bose set. If you want to drown out the co-worker in the next office and listen to some (insert rock/pop artist of your choice), these will do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Duval

customer_reviews.title: Minimal noise cancelling but good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This won't work as well as other headphones costing 10x more. However, for the price, it isn't bad. I bought it to keep at the office or take on travel to reduce the amount of noise. If I lose them, I won't be very upset. However, if you need really good noise cancelling, skip this one and buy a more expensive pair.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the quality
customer_reviews.text: For the first few months, I would have rated this 5 stars. The headphones have not been handled roughly. They sit on the table next to the computer. Then I noticed the sound cancellation was not as good as before. Replaced the battery... didn't help. So after looking at it a few times, I found that the cord cover had pulled away so I'm assuming there is something wrong with the wires that has resulted in the decreased performance. I expect better from Sony.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Hurts your head
customer_reviews.text: Omg these are so uncomfortable. Some things are worth paying a little more for better quality. They hurt the top of my head within 10 minutes of wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Schakel

customer_reviews.title: Not too Bad (and relatively inexpensive )
customer_reviews.text: So, for onboard aircraft, these are solid. I also use them when walking--I listen to audio books, not music so much. But I also use them when I play the piano. Sound quality is good. Because they are good and inexpensive, I bought a second pair for my laptop. These are not too bad. You could spend a bunch more money, but these will work in a bunch of different areas, audio books, music, laptop, and airplane.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Wanless

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, noise cancellation feature actually works
customer_reviews.text: Has really great sound, and the noise cancellation feature actually works pretty well. It does not kill all the noise, of course, but makes a noticeable difference. It is a bit clumsy, so I would recommend getting a case if you’re going to travel with it. Price is also a big selling point. I suppose if you travel all the time or would wear them everyday for a loud workplace or whatever, it would be worth getting the more expensive Bose, but you’re an occassional traveler and also want to have a quality set of headphones for occasional home use, these are the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Edawg

customer_reviews.title: Not your typical noise canecelling headphones
customer_reviews.text: I was initially skeptical on the noise cancellation feature on these headphones. That is, until I used them with audio output. They appear to augment the sound output that isn't actually making it louder, just more dominant, more defined. I am sure that there are better technical ways to explain this. But if you want headphones to just block out sound, try something else. But using these while listening to audio really is a quite a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: Multitaskle

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two pair of these headphones for a long trip to Europe. For cheap headphones the noise-cancelling worked well on the flight. They worked plugged into my phone, my tablet, and the plane's audio/video system. I had tried to use earbuds on prior flights and they really don't work with all the background noise. I'm sure $350 headphones work better, but I was very happy with these. I noticed a significant improvement when I turned on the noise-cancelling feature. I bought the case that Amazon sells and I recommend it too.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kimbrough

customer_reviews.title: Great for Airplane movies!
customer_reviews.text: These are a big improvement over earbuds for movies on a jet plane. I can actually understand the words and enjoy the movie. Noise reduction seems closer to 50% than 90%, but enough to work on a jet. These are perfect for air travel. Cheap, small & fold flat. I would never travel around the world with 99% perfect $300 headphones! Doubt they are audiophile quality for serious listening, but perfect jet phones!
customer_reviews.author: Vortex

customer_reviews.title: Noise Canceling works great.
customer_reviews.text: It seems as if you can only listen with the noise canceling on or else it sounds very bad. With noise canceling option on they work great and sounds high quality. I was very impressed. I give 4 stars because the headphones do not have any padding on the arch which sits on top of your head its just plastic and it can be uncomfortable at times.
customer_reviews.author: dawid

customer_reviews.title: Yes I am totally oblivious and very happy about this
customer_reviews.text: People around me complain that when they have arguments and someone yells I'm totally oblivious. Yes I am totally oblivious and very happy about this!! I plug this thing into Roku and have a full cinema experience. I take it with me on the road and everywhere. Sometimes the padding comes loose and needs put back on but that's the only problem I have had. Very good investment for 30 bucks!!
customer_reviews.author: Jolly

customer_reviews.title: so
customer_reviews.text: I've been going back and forth for a long time between buying an expensive pair of noise canceling/reducing headphones or something that won't break the bank. These clearly don't break the bank but after my first day of use, I'm really happy I didn't dish out $300+ for something more fancy. The noise reduction is great, the sound is great, it came with a AAA battery conveniently, and the pack really well. So far, I'm really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyn

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these during my quest to find noise-cancelling headphones that would fit a smaller adult head (impossible for some reason). These fit and considering the price, worked quite well! I wore them on a long international flight and there was a significant difference when it came to listening to music/watching movies. I don't love the fact that they're on-ear rather than over-ear, however I didn't notice any ear soreness so it's fine. If you're looking for affordable noise-cancelling and have a smaller head, I'd definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the price
customer_reviews.text: I don't have Bose noise canceling headphones, so I'm not able to compare. But I travel for work often and I like to watch downloaded Netflix and Amazon Prime shows on my tablet while flying. The noise canceling feature really works and the sound is good. They fold up nicely so I easily can put them in my briefcase upon arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Morten K Aagaard

customer_reviews.title: good inexpensive headphones that work well.
customer_reviews.text: finally used these - I really like the sound proofing - they are heavier than i expected - meaning in carry on bag. but really do cancel out sound, especially when 'turned on'. so it was great to listen to book on plane. Well worth it - and very reasonably priced. If you only use periodically - I don't use it for gaming or anything else - just flying a few times a year - so good buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to fly over seas. We haven’t gone yet so I’ll write another review after our trip testing the quality of the sound and noise cancelling in flight. So far they have been great. Comfortable. Easy to change to fit all head sizes and shapes. Great sound quality while in the house and other noise is going on.
customer_reviews.author: nat200

customer_reviews.title: Great price for quality!
customer_reviews.text: It’s very light weight, given that there’s a AA battery in it, noise canceling works well (not the best but very good for this price point). Folding ear pieces feature is great for traveling! Highly recommended! I got all the requirements that I wanted and lower price then I expected. Plus these headphones were for my 8 years old! We’ve bought other noise canceling headphones to tryout: Bose QC25, was $200+ (heavier, but works well for the price point), Panasonic RP-HT161-K was $20 (noise canceling isn’t detected).
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Great budget noise cancelling set
customer_reviews.text: Great little entry level noise cancelling set. Travelled two trips app that lasted 14 and 28 hours respectively (28k miles +/-) since January. Did not feel the on ear cup was hurting even after extended use. Noise cancelling feature was noticeable and effective enough to drown out most of plane background noise (777). Felt it was an excellent value even if not completely noise free. Got another set for daughter. Probably small enough for kids 5 y/o and older.
customer_reviews.author: T. Chargualaf

customer_reviews.title: Decent headphones
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using the Sony MD6504s for 10+ years, I ordered these based on reviews. I use these while DJ'ing and while they get the job done, not ideal for that purpose. I feel like noise cancellation just makes them louder, can't really comment on that aspect. With that said, I prefer over the ear rather than on the ear. Comfortable for the most part, good clean sound and dont feel fatigued after an hour or two of use.
customer_reviews.author: Kelso

customer_reviews.title: Best for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -REAL BATTERY POWERED NOISE CANCELING. No BS. Noise canceling works better than expected. -Fair price from a real brand -Foldable -Comfortable- the reviews that state these headphones are too small are totally wrong. These are obviously "on ear" headphones. Those that we're expecting "over ear" headphones need to get better at using the internet. Cons: -build quality seems cheap. However, I just took two pair to Europe without a case and just had them getting thrashed in my pack and both pair survived. -"on ear" style can hurt after a 12 hour flight. -No external volume control -No mic for phone calls -Cable is attached to both sides rather than just one.
customer_reviews.author: Bro Montana

customer_reviews.title: Not Quite Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to wear to the gym, so I can watch TV on the treadmill and not hear the loud, sometimes obnoxious, music being piped in. I thought they were doing a good job until yesterday when two men were talking loudly behind me. I had the noise cancelling on, but the headphones actually amplified their noise, so it seemed as though they were shouting. I have a pair of older, cheaper flimsier Sony noise cancelling headphones that actually cancel noise. I do not know what these headphones would do with, for example, a crying baby on an airplane.
customer_reviews.author: F. E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased these for a flight, needed some affordable headphones for my 3 Yo as the previous pair (cheap brand) only made it for a flight out and broke on the way back back. These seem to be better built and worked wonderfully for our trip. Lesson learned, stick with reliable brands! These were affordable, had enough noise cancelling & fit the toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Monkey Joe

customer_reviews.title: Peace & Quiet Finally!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones work amazing for my son who sleeps during the day and needs to cancel out the noise of the day. My son cannot hear dogs barking, the train that runs a block from our house, cars, lawn mowers or any other distracting noises. The sound quality of the headphones is amazing as well. These are great headphones and the price is great as well!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for our toddler to watch DVDs on an airplane flight. On the tightest setting, they fit great on his slightly-larger-than-average head. They aren’t the best in terms of noise cancellation, but it was what we expected for the price. (They were definitely loud enough to hear the sound over the plane’s engines.) There is a faint buzzing noise in the background when turned on, but it didn’t seem to bother our son.
customer_reviews.author: Kilikikina22

customer_reviews.title: Good price, but not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift, my son loves them! Excellent headphones! My only problem with them, they break too easily! He wears them daily, and is not too rough with them, yet this is his third pair in 2 years! If it's not the wiring it's the ear cushions, last pair it was the jack which went out in less than a year. I know things aren't built to last but, sheesh!
customer_reviews.author: JD Smyth

customer_reviews.title: A great headphone for the money
customer_reviews.text: A great headphone for the money. I rely on these at work to keep out the background noise and better concentrate on the project at hand. I recommend these for an inexpensive solution and the sound is exceptional, they get the job done at an affordable solution. And they look nice too. The only thing is the batteries run out pretty quick but for me they really don't make that much of difference so I don't use the batteries. If your hearing is a little more sensitive than mine, you might need to use the batteries. over all very satisfied and I recommend these to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Art.D

customer_reviews.title: Poor noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect Bose quality but I almost returned the Sony MDRZX110NC as defective. Noise cancelling is almost nil. Sound quality is decent and I don't actually use them for the noise cancelling feature anyway. Do yourself a favor and spend a little more for quality noise cancelling.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora1957

customer_reviews.title: very light
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for air travel instead of uncomfortable earbuds. Haven't traveled yet. Tried at home and the sound quality is good, light, fold compactly. Reasonable price. Seem to filter out outside noises
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Gallo

customer_reviews.title: They're ok, but not true noise cancelling.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned very good Sony noise cancelling headphones in the past, but these basically just increase the volume to drown out the background noise when you turn the noise cancelling function on. They do sound good and they are reasonable priced, so I am giving them a 4 star review, but make no mistake they are not high quality noise cancelling headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Fink

customer_reviews.title: when the noise cancelling is turned off the audio quality is poor - low volume and hollow - sound quality is ...
customer_reviews.text: By in large it works. However, there are some caveats. 1. it cancels low frequency constant noise well (HVAC hum, fans, motors, etc.) it is not nearly as effective for voices. 2. when the noise cancelling is turned off the audio quality is poor - low volume and hollow - sound quality is great with active cancelling on. 3. the cord is VERY short - if your PC is under your desk, buy an extension cord. 4) the ear pads are tiny - larger ear pads improve noise blocking. 5) the head strap doesn't fit my head very well.
customer_reviews.author: William H. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Expected better
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of cheap noise canceling headphones that work better. These require a battery to have the volume up to cancel the noise, but when you have that function “on” there is a static. So you either get to listen on a low non-noise canceling volume OR a higher volume with background static. I wouldn’t recommend these for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Twiztedpeanuts

product_meta.title: Sony MDRZX110NC Noise Cancelling Headphones, Black, medium
product_meta.description: Style:MDR-ZX110NCSay goodbye to distraction with the MDR-ZX110NC Noise Cancelling Headphones. Featuring a 12–22,000 Hz frequency response for pristine bass, mids, and treble, these lightweight headphones reduce ambient noise by 95%, so all you’ll hear is the music. Plus, you can listen for longer with 80 hours of battery life. The noise canceling function is effective in low frequency ranges and is not as effective for higher frequencies Cord Length: 3.94 ft; Frequency Response: 10–22,000 Hz.Frequency Response:10–22,000 Hz
feature_bullets: Over ear, Noise isolating Headphones. Connectivity Technology: Wired
30mm Neodymium Driver. 110 dB/mW – Power off, 115 dB/mW – Power on
Up To 80 Hours Of Battery Life
Impedance (Ohm) Power ON 220 ohm, OFF 45 ohm (at 1 kHz).Cord Length:3.94 ft

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars3,854 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
